name: Hotel Cabin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually spend considerable amount of time researching the hotels I stay in, how I got this one, I'll never know! I guess I was fooled by a 'good' streak of recommendations on tripadvisor which made me book here. Thanks NOT to the people that gave it more than the 1 star it deserves.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!!!

reviews.text: TO THESE FOLKS: This hotel is NOT cheap, it simply gives you half a room for half a price! And what a crappy half!
reviews.title: On price paid this is a good hotel if you are ok with small rooms
The most "cabiny" room you could imagine - not recommended!
reviews.text: Yes, it costed 70$, cheap by Icelandic standards, but just a day afterwards, I stayed in a perfectly good hotel in London for the same price. The truth is that this hotel is a money making machine, generating huge revenue (all organized tours sleep there!) with very very little expenditures.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are TWICE as small as normal hotel rooms, so two rooms at 70$ really give you 140$ for a normal sized room. So they get their 140$ for the same space a normal hotel would have offered, but in return they give you the cheapest furnishings possible (IKEA is pure luxury in comparison), the worst bathroom, stained carpeting, and 'barely there' lighting.
reviews.title: Nightmare

reviews.text: On TOP of all, they also have INSIDE rooms, just like inside cabins on a cruise ships, whose only handkierchief sized window faces the hallway. We were given one of these, check out my pictures.
reviews.title: a good place to stay in iceland
A wonderful weekend
reviews.text: L.Eldridge Cabin ~Hotel Reykjavik.
4th - 7th October, 2008
reviews.title: Stolen laptop, money and documents - no apologies from the hotel

likes.disliked: — Theft of valuables, lack of competence and lack of apologies from the hotel

reviews.text: Two friends and i thoroughtly enjoyed our stay at the Cabin Hotel. It was clean. breakfast good and rooms basic but adaquate.
reviews.title: Loved the Place

reviews.text: Most of the staff were very friendly (just one who seemed a little reluctant to serve us in the bar??!!)
reviews.title: Maybe the best value hotel in western Europe?

reviews.text: We would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Icelandair as a budget package expecting a three star hotel perhaps the equivalent of a Travelodge or Premier Travel Inn in the UK.
reviews.title: OK for shool parties!

likes.disliked: — Room size, lack of sound proofing and no external windows.

reviews.text: We were late arriving due to a delayed flight and were booked into a room the size of a cupboard at 5am. The walls were paper thin and we could hear the snorers next door. The room was in the centre of the hotel and our bedroom window looked out into the corridor, whilst our door opened to the corridor the other side of the room. Thus movement all round, no natural light and no space. There was insufficient storage space for one case or two people's clothes. Beds were very narrow with ill fitting sheets and pillows which we would describe as cotton wool balls inside a bag. Two people could not move in the room at the same time - no passing space!
reviews.title: A good base for outer activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a little over two hours to sleep before our excursion we were awoken before our alarm went off by a school teacher systematically knocking at all his students doors to awake them with his cheery 'Good Morning!' call.
reviews.title: Stay at the bigger Rooms

reviews.text: Up for a quick shower (the shower room was clean if small) and suddenly the floor of the bathroom was awash and water seeped out onto the carpet outside as the drain was blocked.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Down for breakfast and a queue a mile long with three school parties all up before their day on the road. Food was very limited in choice and with no opportunity to get back for more because of the continuing queue we were restricted to what we could carry. Shared a nice conversation with three school students from Newcastle in what can only be described as the ambience of a school canteen.
reviews.title: GOOD VALUE - CLEAN HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a stay at the Cabin Hotel in Reykjavik recently, we booked it as it was cheap, and weren't expecting much. How wrong we were!
reviews.title: Excellent, amazing value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel appears to be fairly new, and is one block away from the waterfront. Although it is a 10 minute walk away from the city centre, the location is still pretty good. The room wasn't the biggest we ever saw, and although we asked for a double room, we ended up in a room with three single beds. The room was clean and quiet however, and provided all facilities expected, albeit it without coffee/tea making facilities.
reviews.title: Take a DeLuxe room

reviews.text: The do provide a breakfest however, which is pretty amazing considering the price of $110 for 3 nights! The breakfest was rather basic, but hey, it's free!
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but avoid the standard rooms!

reviews.text: The staff were extremely friendly and helpfull, and the coach from the airport drops you off right on the hotel's doorstep.
reviews.title: Great if you upgrade your room!

likes.disliked: — The standard rooms - PAY FOR THE UPGRADE!

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay, and would certainly recommend this hotel for a stay in Reykjavik
reviews.title: OK as a base

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Cabin on a five day trip in December. I went for the Deluxe Room and I found this was roomy enough for me. The bathroom is a little pokey but has hot water and was fine for the stay.
reviews.title: Cheap but not nasty
Cheap and easy
reviews.text: My room was given a good clean each day and I made the most of the Continental Buffet breakfast. If you're not expecting English Breakfast you'll be fine. The wifi and high-speed internet was too expensive for my liking. ISK500 for 15 mins. ISK900 for an hour and over ISK 1000 for 24 hours access. I went to Cafe Karama in town instead and got it for free. The TV in the room has AV inputs if you want to watch things from your laptop.

reviews.title: IDEAL..
reviews.text: The hotel is about a 15-20 min walk from the city centre. There's an N1 Petrol station across the road and a 24-hour 101 supermarket a block up the road if you want snacks or supplies. You can even eat microwave meals in the supermarket if you want to go really cheap.
Staff were helpful with sorting out the airport bus and lent me a power adaptor as well. There were no hassles with getting picked up and delivered back to the hotel for day trips.
reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
Very affordable, clean, and close to downtown hotel
reviews.text: I'd certainly recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here for 6 nights at the beginning of october 2009 -- for EVE fanfest.
reviews.title: cozy and great value

reviews.text: the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. they helped us with directions, booking tours, basic advcie, calling taxis, etc. the breakfast buffet was a bit repetitious, but fine overall and good strong coffee. it was nice that thye let us eat at the buffet the first monrirng when we got in. alos, we were able to check in right away even though it was super early. as others have said, the walk into town is about 20 minutes. taxis are expensive, the public bus is pretty cheap and runs often. our room was a good size -- as a couple, we didnt expect two single beds pushed together, but whatever ... it was okay. it was nice having a fridge in the room, we stocked it with snackcs and drink.
reviews.title: Simple hotel with good value meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ~we will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights and room is small but clean and with TV. Easy to take the Bus 12 into the centre about 5 mins or walk along the seafront 25 mins. Close to a public open air heated pool /spa about 5 mins walk away and all excursions run from the hotel. City is quite expensive so sightseeing is better than shopping ! Blue Lagoon spa was a highlight of the trip. Wanted to see Northern Lights but weather not suitable, it has to be clear. Hotel has buffet lunch and dinner which were very good value and can be paid for on the spot.
reviews.title: really nice hotel!

reviews.text: I'd recommend a deluxe room if you have luggage - we did and had a comfortable stay for very good value. I'm not sure what some people expect for breakfast when you pay 20 quid per night but cereals, toast & breads, cheese/meat/salad/eggs, juice, tea & coffee are more than sufficient for me. Staff were consistently helpful. My only complaint is that the wireless internet frequently droppped out, but that's pretty minor in the scheme of things. All tours pick you up, so being a little bit out of the centre doesn't really matter. The no 12 bus goes from out the front.
reviews.title: Cheap, functional but uninspiring place to stay. The rooms however are very small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very clean and cozy hotel. We paied $45 per night and it is totally worthy.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit out of town. About 10Euro with a taxi. The hotel is ok, but the service in the reseption could been better. The worst thing about the hotel is the brekfast. It is very bad. We had it included in the price but we choose to eat outside after the first day!
reviews.title: Nice room but terrible brekfast
Lovely room and service
reviews.text: The hotel itself was lovely with a reasonably spacious room and good bathroom facilities. It is out of the city centre but is about a 20 min walk away from the central area - can have a nice scenic walk along the bay. The tour companies come to the hotel for pick up - definitely a must! Breakfast was standard with tea/coffee/juice, generic cornflakes, toast, jams, cheese, ham, cucumber, tomatoes and sometimes some fruit! A reasonably priced hotel - had a very good stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay so the room isn't exactly six foot long, but this is not a hotel for people who are claustrophobic. The bathroom reminds me of a space pods from star trek. Our room had an ok view where we could see the water and the mountains. However, if you are a light sleeper the curtains do not block out all the sunlight. Service was ok, but the front desk missed two of my wake up calls. The hotel is a value, but listen to the reviews! The rooms are small! Not Holiday Inn small, walk in closet small! Positives are the location, close to the water and the thermal pools and on two bus routes.
reviews.title: 6'3 man in a 6 foot long room!
Think about the worst place you have ever stayed in.......
reviews.text: ........and anything good is a bonus!
I paid so little for the package (Flight from London, 3 nights hotel & breakfast for £259 - Icelandair Holidays) that there is no way anybody could complain.
reviews.title: Strange room, but otherwise OK

reviews.text: The place was spotlessly clean, staff friendly and efficient, decent bar and so on. Hotel on the Flybus circuit, so getting there from airport and getting to excursions etc was really easy.
reviews.title: Cheap Way to stay in Reykjavik with Comfort

likes.liked: — Had everything I needed to be and Icelandic tourist

reviews.text: It is called the Cabin because the bedrooms are modelled on cruise ship cabins. There are even ones without windows - inside cabins!!. Fortunately I had one facing Reykjavik bay with a half decent view. That said, modern cruise liners have considerably bigger cabins than what was on offer here. Strictly two single beds either side of a small gap and a very small shower room. TV on brcket on wall, very small table. I was by myself. If there had been two of us it would have been claustrophobic and even more so in an "inside" room.
reviews.title: A Good Budget Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other strange thing was beds had no headboards (you couldn't push bed against wall as it was under an overhang and you would simply bang your head against it, so pillow kept dropping off into the gap!!), and a water driven radiator had been crudely chopped out (even pipes just sticking strait out of wall with an old thermostat still atached) and an electric heater dropped in place.
reviews.title: OK if you are not in the standard rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Straight forward 15-20 minute walk to centre of town. That also applies even to some of the big, plush hotels. The single biggest issue was that there were no restaurants nearby as it is basically in a commercial district. (hotel only offers breakfast and basic snacks in bar) Only a Subway in the petrol station opposite, and a 24-hour convenience store in the next block. Dominos about 10 minute walk - but as it is in the direction of City Centre keep going and then there are plenty of places to eat.
reviews.title: I'd recommend it

description: Hotel Cabin is a modern hotel designed for the modern traveler and equipped with all the facilities that a modern traveler needs. Our main policy has always been, to offer travelers visiting Reykjavík comfortable and economic accomodation right in the heart of the city. The standard rooms are the cheapest accommodation we have to offer and as the name implies they are very basic but comfortable. The Deluxe rooms are bigger and come with a bathtub with a shower and refrigerator. The Superior rooms are all on the hotel´s 7th floor and offer a magnificent view of the city or the ocean. They come with a free wireless internet, a refrigerator, a tea- and coffee maker and a hairdryer.The hotel is excellently located within a walking distance from the city center as well as the Laugardalur area.Laugardalur (Hot Spring Valley) is a centre for sports and recreation in the capital. In Laugardalur you will find the Botanical Gardens and the largest outdoor thermal pool in Reykajvík, Laugardalslaug. The facilities there include a water slide, hot tubs and a geothermal sauna. Also located in laugardalur are Laugardalsvöllur Sport Stadium and Laugar fitness spa. The popular family park and Zoo in Laugardalur is open all year round.
